quotes: Ogata was appointed to Japan's UN mission in 1968, on the recommendation of Fusae Ichikawa
Ogata represented Japan at several sessions of the UN General Assembly in 1970.
she served from 1978 to 1979 as Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary for the permanent mission of Japan to the UN
In 1990, she was appointed as head of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR).
She was re-elected twice (in November 1993 and in September 1998)
and served, over a decade, until 2001.
After UNHCR leader, in 2001, she became co-chairperson of UN Human Security Commission.
In December 2000, and coinciding with the end of her second term at the High Commission at UNHCR, as well as the 50th anniversary
